tips: Use a Mace with the Wind Burst enchantment to stay airborne!
Trial Chambers are found deep underground in the Overworld.
Copper Bulbs have different light levels based on oxidation.
Breeze Rods can be crafted into Wind Charges.
Heavy Cores are rare rewards from Trial Vaults.
You can use an Axe to scrape oxidation off Copper blocks.
Crafters require a Redstone signal to skip a slot.
The Bogged is a new skeleton variant that fires poison arrows.
Armadillo Scutes can be used to craft Wolf Armor.
Vaults can be opened by every player once using a Trial Key.
Don't dig straight down!
Crouch to avoid falling off ledges.
Gold tools are faster but break easily.
Beds explode in the Nether.
Endermen hate water.
Use a silk touch pickaxe for glass.
Axes disable shields.
Fortune works on coal, diamonds, and iron.
Torches prevent monster spawns.
Sprinting makes you hungrier.
Smelt sand to get glass.
Villagers love emeralds.
Zombies burn in sunlight.
Creepers are afraid of cats.
Water buckets negate fall damage.
Pigs love carrots.
Wolves love bones.
Shear sheep for more wool.
Milk removes all potion effects.
Riptide tridents only work in rain.
Looting increases mob drops.
Fire Aspect cooks meat instantly.
Wearing gold prevents Piglin attacks.
Barter with Piglins using gold ingots.
Ancient Debris is found deep in the Nether.
Ghasts hate their own fireballs.
Blazes are weak to snowballs.
Soul Sand slows you down.
Blue ice is the fastest for boat travel.
Phantoms spawn if you don't sleep.
Scaffolding is great for building.
Composters turn food into bone meal.
Barrels are cheaper than chests.
Smokers cook food twice as fast.
Blast furnaces smelt ore faster.
Anvils can rename your items.
Grindstones remove enchantments.
Lecterns hold books for reading.
Stonecutters save stairs and slabs.
Target blocks produce Redstone signals.
Honey blocks prevent sticking to walls.
Slime blocks make you bounce.
Observers detect block updates.
Hoppers move items between containers.
Redstone repeaters delay signals.
Comparators detect container fullness.
Dispensers can equip armor for you.
Droppers just drop items.
Note blocks play music.
Jukeboxes play music discs.
Conduits help you breathe underwater.
Dolphins lead you to shipwrecks.
Turtles drop scutes when they grow.
Axolotls help you fight guardians.
Guardians hate being out of water.
Bees produce honey and wax.
Copper oxidizes over time.
Honeycomb prevents copper oxidation.
Lightning rods protect wooden roofs.
Amethyst grows on budding geodes.
Spyglasses zoom in on the horizon.
Goats can ram you off cliffs.
Allays love items and music.
Frogs eat small slimes.
Mud is made from dirt and water.
Mangrove trees grow in water.
Sniffers find ancient seeds.
Camel dashes jump over ravines.
Bamboo can be used for wood.
Armor trims are found in structures.
Smithing templates are required for upgrades.
Netherite requires a smithing template.
Trail Ruins are buried underground.
Suspicious gravel can be brushed.
Trial Chambers are full of loot.
Trial Spawners give rewards.
Trial Keys unlock Vaults.
The Breeze drops Breeze Rods.
The Bogged fires poison arrows.
Maces do more damage from heights.
Wind Charges launch you upward.
Crafters automate your crafting.
Copper Bulbs change light levels.
Heavy Cores craft the Mace.
Ominous Trials are harder but better.
Bad Omen triggers Ominous Trials.
Drink Ominous Bottles for a challenge.
Vaults can be opened by everyone.
Chiseled Tuff looks great for builds.
Copper Grates allow light through.
Hardened glass won't break easily.
Sugar cane grows on sand or dirt.
Pumpkins need space to grow.
Melons need space to grow.
Sweet berries slow you down.
Campfires can cook four items.
Bells alert villagers to raids.
Ravagers are afraid of rabbits.
Evokers turn blue sheep red.
The Wither is a powerful boss.
Punching TNT with Flint and Steel ignites it.
Bows with Power V deal massive damage.
Infinity bows don't need extra arrows.
Mending repairs gear using XP orbs.
Unbreaking III makes gear last longer.
Efficiency V mines blocks instantly.
Silk Touch collects beehives with bees inside.
Depth Strider makes you swim faster.
Frost Walker turns water into ice.
Feather Falling IV reduces fall damage.
Blast Protection saves you from Creepers.
Projectile Protection reduces arrow damage.
Fire Protection is essential for the Nether.
Swift Sneak makes you crouch-walk faster.
Soul Speed is faster on Soul Sand.
Thorns damage enemies who hit you.
Respiration III lets you breathe longer.
Aqua Affinity speeds up underwater mining.
Multishot fires three arrows for one.
Piercing arrows go through multiple mobs.
Quick Charge makes crossbows fire faster.
Channeling strikes lightning during storms.
Impaling deals extra damage to sea life.
Loyalty tridents fly back to you.
Ender Pearls teleport you instantly.
Chorus Fruit teleports you randomly.
Totems of Undying save you from death.
Shields block 100% of melee damage.
Gold apples give extra health hearts.
Enchanted apples give massive buffs.
Potions of Speed make you run faster.
Potions of Strength increase melee damage.
Potions of Haste speed up mining.
Potions of Invisibility hide you from mobs.
Potions of Night Vision see in the dark.
Potions of Fire Resistance stop lava damage.
Potions of Slow Falling prevent fall death.
Potions of Water Breathing are for diving.
Lingering potions create effect clouds.
Splash potions affect multiple entities.
Arrows can be tipped with potion effects.
Spectral arrows highlight enemies.
Weakness potions help cure Zombie Villagers.
Golden apples help cure Zombie Villagers.
Fletching tables create tipped arrows.
Cartography tables zoom out your maps.
Loom tables make custom banner designs.
Smite deals extra damage to the undead.
Bane of Arthropods kills spiders fast.
Knockback pushes enemies far away.
Fireballs can be hit back at Ghasts.
Magma blocks deal damage when stepped on.
Crouching prevents magma block damage.
Ice blocks melt near light sources.
Packed ice never melts in light.
Blue ice is the slipperiest block.
Lava flows further in the Nether.
Water cannot be placed in the Nether.
Cauldrons can hold water in the Nether.
Sponge blocks soak up nearby water.
Wet sponges can be dried in furnaces.
Conduits require a prismarine frame.
Beacons require a pyramid base.
Beacons give powerful area-of-effect buffs.
Nether Stars are dropped by the Wither.
Wither Skeletons drop rare skulls.
Ender Dragons drop Dragon Breath.
Elytra let you glide through the sky.
Fireworks boost your Elytra flight.
Shulker Boxes are portable chests.
Shulker Shells are dropped in End Cities.
Dragon Heads look cool on walls.
End Crystals respawn the Ender Dragon.
Silverfish spawn from infested blocks.
Endermites sometimes spawn from pearls.
Wandering Traders offer exotic items.
Lead animals to move them easily.
Name tags prevent mobs from despawning.
Saddles let you ride horses and pigs.
Horse armor protects your mount.
Llamas can carry chests for storage.
Mules are a cross between horses and donkeys.
Striders can walk on lava with saddles.
Warped fungus on a stick guides Striders.
Carrot on a stick guides pigs.
Ravagers can be stunned by shields.
Vexes can fly through solid blocks.
Vindicators are fast and dangerous.
Pillager Outposts hold trapped Allays.
Raids start when entering a village.
Hero of the Village gives discounts.
Villagers change jobs based on blocks.
Iron Golems protect villages from sieges.
Snow Golems leave a trail of snow.
Pumpkin masks hide you from Endermen.
Dye leather armor using a cauldron.
Suspicious stew gives random effects.
Brushes are used for archeology.
Pottery Sherds make decorated pots.
Sniffer eggs hatch on moss blocks.
Lava buckets are the best furnace fuel.
Bows can be repaired with thread.
Wooden buttons have a longer signal.
Pressure plates detect items or players.
Iron doors require a redstone signal.
Trapdoors can be used as ladders.
Slabs prevent mob spawning.
Stairs can be waterlogged.
Fences connect to most solid blocks.
Gates can be opened both ways.
Anvils fall and deal damage.
Dripstone can kill if it falls on you.
Pointed dripstone fills cauldrons.
Powder snow can freeze you.
Leather boots let you walk on snow.
Magma cubes are immune to fire.
Strider babies can ride adults.
Piglin Brutes never barter.
Hoglins are afraid of warped fungus.
Zoglins are afraid of nothing.
Bastions are full of gold blocks.
Lodestones help you navigate.
Compasses point to world spawn.
Recovery compasses show last death.
Clocks show the time of day.
Daylight sensors detect the sun.
Glass bottles collect dragon breath.
Dragon breath crafts lingering potions.
Arrows fly further if you jump-shot.
Sweet berry bushes damage mobs.
Cactus blocks destroy items.
Sand falls if there is no block below.
Gravel falls if there is no block below.
Concrete is made by wetting powder.
Wool muffles the sound of footsteps.
Carpet can be placed over string.
Item frames can be placed on floors.
Glow ink sacs make signs glow.
Regular ink sacs clear sign glow.
Honey bottles remove poison.
Sugar speeds up baby horses.
Wheat heals injured cows.
Seeds heal injured chickens.
Raw fish heals injured cats.
Rotten flesh heals injured wolves.
Zombies can break wooden doors.
Skeleton horses spawn during storms.
Trident drowned only spawn in oceans.
Slimes only spawn in certain chunks.
Witches use potions to heal.
Vexes are summoned by Evokers.
Illusioners are hidden in the code.
The Warden reacts to vibrations.
Sneaking hides you from the Warden.
Wool blocks block Warden vibrations.
Echo shards craft recovery compasses.
Swift Sneak is found in Ancient Cities.
Silence Armor Trim is the rarest.
Spore blossoms create green particles.
Big dripleaves collapse under weight.
Small dripleaves need bone meal.
Azalea trees mark lush caves.
Glow berries provide light and food.
Spies can see through tinted glass.
Tinted glass blocks light completely.
Amethyst clusters drop four shards.
Calibrated sculks sense specific sounds.
Sculk shriekers summon the Warden.
Sculk catalysts create sculk blocks.
Bells can be rung with arrows.
Soul torches give off low light.
Crying obsidian sets spawn in Nether.
Respawn anchors need glowstone.
Nether gold ore drops nuggets.
Gilded blackstone drops gold nuggets.
Nether sprouts are just for looks.
Crimson fungus breeds Hoglins.
Warped fungus breeds nothing.
Twisting vines grow upward.
Weeping vines grow downward.
Basalt forms from blue ice and lava.
Cobblestone forms from water and lava.
Obsidian forms when water hits source lava.
Crying obsidian cannot be moved by pistons.
Bedrock is unbreakable in survival.
End portal frames are unbreakable.
Silverfish hide inside stone bricks.
Strongholds have libraries full of books.
Eyes of Ender lead to the portal.
Shulkers fire levitation bullets.
End ships hold the Elytra.
Dragon eggs are unique trophies.
Beacons can be colored with glass.
Armor stands can hold any item.
Pistons can push up to 12 blocks.
Sticky pistons pull blocks back.
Slime and Honey don't stick together.
Redstone torches invert signals.
TNT can be lit with fire charges.
Hardcore mode means one life only.
The Mace deals more damage the further you fall before hitting!
Wind Burst enchantment on a Mace can launch you back into the air.
The Breach enchantment reduces the effectiveness of enemy armor.
Density enchantment increases the damage dealt per block fallen.
Mace smash attacks negate all fall damage if you land the hit!
Combine a Breeze Rod and a Heavy Core to craft the Mace.
Heavy Cores are found rarely within Ominous Vaults.
Ominous Trials are started by drinking a Trial Omen bottle.
Trial Omens are gained by defeating Raid Captains outside of raids.
The Breeze can reflect projectiles back at you with its wind.
Breeze Rods are essential for crafting the new Wind Charges.
Wind Charges allow you to 'rocket jump' like a Breeze!
Vaults in Trial Chambers can be looted by every player once.
Ominous Vaults have better loot but require Ominous Trial Keys.
Trial Spawners adjust their difficulty based on how many players are nearby.
Trial Spawners eject rewards like Trial Keys after all mobs are defeated.
The Bogged skeleton variant spawns in Swamps and Trial Chambers.
You can shear a Bogged to get mushrooms from its head!
Copper Bulbs don't give off light when fully oxidized.
Wax your Copper Bulbs to lock in their specific light level.
The Crafter can be automated with Hoppers for infinite crafting.
Use Redstone Comparators to read how many slots are filled in a Crafter.
Chiseled Tuff and Polished Tuff are great new building blocks.
Trial Chambers contain hidden chests behind some decorative walls.
Flow Armor Trims are found only in Trial Chamber Vaults.
The Bolt Armor Trim has a unique mechanical look.
Guster Pottery Sherds feature the Breeze's iconic swirl.
Trial Spawners have a 30-minute cooldown after being defeated.
Ominous Spawners fire projectiles like Potions and Fire Charges at you.
Silverfish Spawners in Trial Chambers can quickly overwhelm you.
Sniffers find ancient seeds by sniffing the ground.
Torchflower seeds can be used to breed Sniffers.
Pitcher Plants are tall, ancient decorative flowers.
Camel saddles allow two players to ride at once.
Camels can dash across large gaps to escape mobs.
Zombies can't reach you while you are riding a Camel.
Suspicious Sand in Desert Temples contains rare Pottery Sherds.
Suspicious Gravel is often found in Trail Ruins.
Trail Ruins are mostly buried; you'll need to dig them out!
Brush suspicious blocks carefully or they will break.
The Recovery Compass points to where you last died.
Echo Shards are needed to craft a Recovery Compass.
Ancient Cities are the only place to find Swift Sneak books.
Swift Sneak allows you to walk faster while crouching.
The Warden is completely blind but has incredible hearing.
Throw projectiles to distract the Warden away from you.
Sculk Sensors can be waterlogged to make them silent.
Wool blocks dampen vibrations, making you invisible to Sculk.
Amethyst Resonators can pass Redstone signals wirelessly.
Allay mobs will collect items for you if you give them one.
Play a Jukebox near an Allay to make it dance!
Give a dancing Allay an Amethyst Shard to duplicate it.
Mangrove Swamps are home to Mud blocks and Frogs.
Frogs produce Froglight when they eat small Magma Cubes.
Different Frog colors produce different colors of Froglight.
Tadpoles grow into different Frogs depending on the biome.
Goat Horns are dropped when a Goat rams a hard block.
Copper Horns were a prototype, but Goat Horns are the real deal!
Glow Ink Sacs make sign text glow in the dark.
Use a Glow Ink Sac on an Item Frame to make it shine.
Firework rockets with stars deal blast damage when fired from Crossbows.
Piercing Crossbows allow one arrow to hit multiple enemies.
Multishot Crossbows fire three arrows for the price of one.
Quick Charge reduces the reload time of your Crossbow.
Shields can block Creeper explosions if you are facing them.
Sweeping Edge increases the damage of your sword's sweep attack.
Knockback is great for keeping Creepers at a distance.
Smite deals massive damage to Undead mobs like Withers.
Bane of Arthropods makes Spiders much easier to deal with.
Fire Aspect is great for combat, but careful with Endermen!
Looting III increases the chance of rare drops like mob heads.
Impaling Tridents deal extra damage to all aquatic mobs.
Loyalty Tridents fly back to your hand after being thrown.
Channeling Tridents summon lightning during thunderstorms.
Riptide Tridents allow you to fly through rain and water.
Punch Bows increase the knockback of your arrows.
Flame Bows ignite enemies and can light TNT from afar.
Infinity Bows never run out of arrows, as long as you have one.
Power V Bows can one-shot most common mobs.
Tipped arrows can apply Potion effects from a distance.
Observers detect block updates in front of them.
Target blocks give a stronger Redstone signal if hit in the center.
Note Blocks play different sounds depending on the block below.
Daylight Sensors can be inverted to turn on lights at night.
Trapped Chests give off a Redstone signal when opened.
Lecterns send a signal when a page is turned.
Redstone Repeaters can delay signals up to 0.4 seconds.
Redstone Comparators can subtract signal strengths.
Hoppers can be disabled by a Redstone signal.
Droppers move items, while Dispensers use them.
Dispensers can equip armor onto players and armor stands.
Dispensers can shear sheep and carve pumpkins automatically.
TNT Minecarts explode instantly if they hit a wall at speed.
Powered Rails can be used to launch Minecarts up slopes.
Detector Rails send a signal when a Minecart passes over.
Activator Rails can eject players from Minecarts.
Redstone Dust can travel up transparent blocks like Glass.
Sticky Pistons can pull other Pistons to create complex doors.
Slime blocks bounce entities high into the air.
Honey blocks prevent jumping but allow you to slide down walls.
Sweet Berry bushes slow you down and deal damage.
Foxes will pick up and use any item you drop.
A Fox holding a Fire Aspect sword can set you on fire!
Polar Bears are peaceful unless you get near their cubs.
Pandas have different personalities based on their genes.
Sneezing baby Pandas can drop Slimeballs.
Parrots mimic the sounds of nearby hostile mobs.
Don't feed chocolate cookies to Parrots; it's poisonous!
Ocelots no longer turn into Cats; they are separate mobs.
Stray Cats spawn in villages and can bring you gifts at night.
Villager gossip determines the price of their trades.
Curing a Zombie Villager gives you massive trade discounts.
Iron Golems spawn in villages to protect against raids.
You can repair an Iron Golem with Iron Ingots.
Ravagers are afraid of Rabbits for some reason!
Vindicators named 'Johnny' will attack every nearby mob.
Evokers turn blue sheep into red sheep with a 'Wololo'.
Totems of Undying must be held to save you from death.
Vexes are summoned by Evokers and can fly through walls.
Phantoms spawn if you haven't slept for three days.
Phantom Membranes are used to repair Elytra.
Slow Falling potions are made using Phantom Membranes.
Drowned mobs can spawn with Tridents and Nautilus Shells.
Conduits protect you underwater and kill nearby mobs.
Turtle shells give you extra breath time underwater.
Scutes are dropped when baby Turtles grow into adults.
Dolphins will lead you to shipwrecks if you feed them fish.
Magma blocks underwater create bubble columns that pull you down.
Soul Sand underwater creates bubble columns that push you up.
Kelp can be smelted into Dried Kelp for a quick snack.
Dried Kelp blocks are a very efficient fuel for furnaces.
Sea Pickles provide light when placed underwater.
Coral fans must stay in water or they will turn gray.
Tropical Fish can be carried in buckets.
Pufferfish deal poison damage if you touch them.
Axolotls will play dead to regenerate health.
Glow Squids drop Glow Ink Sacs for glowing signs.
Lush Caves are filled with Moss, Glow Berries, and Spore Blossoms.
Dripstone Caves contain sharp stalactites that can fall on you.
Pointed Dripstone can be used to create infinite lava or water.
Azalea trees mark the location of a Lush Cave below.
Copper blocks turn green over time due to oxidation.
Lightning Rods protect your wooden roofs from fire.
Spyglasses are crafted from Amethyst and Copper.
Tinted Glass blocks light but is still transparent.
Amethyst Geodes are found deep underground in the Overworld.
Budding Amethyst blocks cannot be moved, even with Silk Touch.
Deepslate is tougher than Stone and takes longer to mine.
Raw Iron, Copper, and Gold save inventory space while mining.
Fortune enchantment works on Raw Ore blocks!
End Crystal beams can be blocked with blocks to stop the Dragon's heal.
The Dragon Breath can be collected in glass bottles.
Lingering potions are made using Dragon Breath.
Wither Skeletons only spawn in Nether Fortresses.
Wither Skulls are needed to summon the Wither boss.
The Wither is much harder to fight on Bedrock Edition!
Beacons provide buffs like Haste and Regeneration.
Netherite armor is fireproof and won't burn in lava.
Ancient Debris is most common at Y-level 15 in the Nether.
Lodestones allow Compasses to point to a specific block.
Striders can walk on lava and be ridden with a saddle.
Warped Fungus on a Stick is used to control Striders.
Hoglins are afraid of Warped Fungus.
Piglins love Gold and will barter with you for it.
Wear Gold armor to stop Piglins from attacking you.
Piglin Brutes protect Bastions and cannot be distracted by Gold.
Zombified Piglins are neutral until you attack them.
Ghast tears are used to brew Regeneration potions.
Blaze rods are the best fuel for brewing stands.
Magma cream is used for Fire Resistance potions.
Soul Speed enchantment makes you run faster on Soul Sand.
Netherite scrap is made by smelting Ancient Debris.
Smithing Templates are required to upgrade to Netherite armor.
Bastions are the best place to find Pigstep music discs.
Ruined Portals appear in both the Overworld and the Nether.
Crying Obsidian can be used to craft Respawn Anchors.
Respawn Anchors allow you to set your spawn in the Nether.
Don't use a Respawn Anchor in the Overworld; it will explode!
Blackstone can be used as a substitute for Cobblestone.
Gilded Blackstone has a chance to drop Gold nuggets.
Basalt Deltas are home to Magma Cubes and ash particles.
Blue Ice is the fastest surface for boat travel.
Packed Ice doesn't melt, even near light sources.
Snow Golems wear pumpkins that can be sheared off.
Leads can be used to tie mobs to fences.
Armor Trims allow you to customize the look of your gear.
Netherite templates are consumed upon use; make copies!
The Silence Armor Trim is the rarest trim in the game.
Trial Chambers are the ultimate test of your combat skills.
You are now a Minecraft Master. Good luck!
